messages: 99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:11): I am trying to use QFtp to list the directory tree, the tree is listed properly but the hidden files doesn't appear
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:12): maybe they should be hidden?
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:12): no I can see them with konqueror
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:12): Any file starts with "." doesn't appear
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:13): yeah sure, but a "." means that they should be hidden, right?
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:13): maybe they just are that, hidden?
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:13): Yes, But I am making a program that download ftp dir with all of its contents
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:13): including hidden files
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:14): maybe hidden files should be hidden?
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:14): what do you mean with "should be"
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:14): It should be hidden to the normal user
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:14): but shouldn't be hidden to my program
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:14): how do you interpret the words "hidden file"?
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:14): should it be hidden or not?
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:15): hidden file in linux means any file starts with dot
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:15): yes, i know that
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:15): i just thinks it does the right thing
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:15): that other ftp clients may do it wrong is another issue
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:16): My question is simple I WANT my program to list those hidden files
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:16): Can you help me or not
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:16): i see nothing in the docs about hidden files, so it's a properly implemented feature or a bug depending on your viewpoint
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:16): send a rawCommand() ?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:16): "ls -la"
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:16): And how can I get the result ?
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:17): http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/qftp.html#rawCommand
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:17): rawCommandReply
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:17): Yes got it, Thanks nuge
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:17): then just some creating QRegExp:ing
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:17): "creative"
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:17): that was very helpful
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:18): oh, sarcasm
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:19): no, i don't thinks he's being sarcastic
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:19): seems like chakie is a bit of a mood today :)
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (01:19): no, it is really a good idea I will do it
de049332bccd50f4795bcc34c66fe4d3 (01:21): what'd i miss?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:21): sugoi, nothing much
de049332bccd50f4795bcc34c66fe4d3 (01:22): not much...im just trying to get a private local game server running at my place
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:22): what game?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:22): the only game
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:23): er hathack
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:23): holy brainfart
de049332bccd50f4795bcc34c66fe4d3 (01:23): haha
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:23): how the hell did i come up with "hathack"
de049332bccd50f4795bcc34c66fe4d3 (01:23): haha
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (01:23): i don't even have an excuse, like alcohol
de049332bccd50f4795bcc34c66fe4d3 (01:24): well...you didn't hear it from me
de049332bccd50f4795bcc34c66fe4d3 (01:24): its kinda frowned upon by the game company
de049332bccd50f4795bcc34c66fe4d3 (01:24): and who knows who's listening :P
de049332bccd50f4795bcc34c66fe4d3 (01:24): haha
de049332bccd50f4795bcc34c66fe4d3 (01:25): but, getting the private server running is to say the least, totally cool ! :)
